blog.title: "I am... Iron Man"

Tony Stark is the Strongest Avenger|

body:
Endgame reunions

People keep talking about Tony’s reunion with the team or Pepper.

I just want him reuniting with DUM-E with the latter letting out happy beeps and boops on seeing his dad after so long

summary: Earth’s Best Defender; Tony Stark Bingo - S4
title: Earth’s Best Defender; Tony Stark Bingo - S4
body:
Square: S4 - Art Format: Stained Glass

Rating: General

Warnings: None

Pairing: None

Summary: Image of the Iron Man armour flying over the earth, done in watercolour and ink in the style of stained glass.

Link: Also on AO3 here

@tonystarkbingo​

My first square filled. not the one I thought it was going to be, and I really need to work on my watercolour skills, but this didn’t turn out too bad. Although, some details and colour is missing in the scan. Maybe digital would have worked better.

blog.name: morgoona-stark
blog.title: "I am... Iron Man"
blog.description:
Tony Stark is the Strongest Avenger| 
Header by @anthonyed

summary:
It was easy, almost too easy for Stephen to fit into the role of a ... Let's say for now, a villain.
His entire life had been...
body:
It was easy, almost too easy for Stephen to fit into the role of a … Let’s say for now, a villain.

His entire life had been him being the centre for jealousy. Hate and jealousy, had fuelled his story and the text book narcissism just added to the perfect antagonistic image that Stephen provided.

Then came the accident.

And then came the agony.

And now he has magic, the ability to bend the rules of reality at the very tips of his fingers.

His sharp sea green eyes, paired with the goatee and the white streaks of hair and the cloak resting menacingly on his shoulders? It was safe to say that Stephen was meant to be the villain.

But then came Tony Stark.

Protector the Weak, the Golden Avenger, the literal shield of this world. Iron fucking Man.

Nobody noticed the wide, brown eyed Tony Stark, the Tony who hid his emotions away but would coo at babies, the Tony whose PTSD kept him awake late into the night, the Tony who was ready to sacrifice himself, everyone saw a man without a heart instead of a man with a broken one.

Until, they noticed what happens to the same man after being betrayed again and again and again until he finally snapped.

(( I’ve always wanted to write a evil Stephen and Tony power duo but never got to posting this draft. Lemme know what you think))

blog.name: strangemischief
blog.title: What Strange Trickery This Is
blog.description: Ironstrange + Supremefamily | Occasional Thor or Loki Content | Side Blog | Tag List | Ao3

title: A Sixth Intrusive Thought
body:
May Parker loved Peter Parker more than anything.

May loved Peter, and for that reason, she cornered him in the bathroom one morning after catching sight of his latest battle scars. “Peter Benjamin Parker, you listen here and listen well. Whenever you go on these missions with Tony and Stephen, you let them take the lead. If something…bad ever happens-”

Peter rolled his eyes and yanked his shirt over his head. “We wouldn’t be there if something bad wasn’t already happening, May.”

“Don’t sass me, Peter! Now listen! If the mission goes bad, I want you to run. You run, even if it means leaving them behind.”

“What!?” Peter gasped, shocked his Aunt would suggest such a thing. “I can’t do that! We’re a team! I’m-”

“A kid,” May finished firmly. “My kid. Tony and Stephen are adults. You leave, Peter. You come home. You live. I want you to promise me right now.”

Peter’s lip twitched in disapproval, but he relented to his Aunt’s demands anyway. It wasn’t like he’d ever have to do it anyway. “I promise, May. I’ll run.”

—

Stephen Strange loved Tony Stark more than anything.

Stephen loved Tony, and for that reason, he decided to make an impossible demand of Peter, despite the thought of what he was to say making his stomach clench. “I need you to do something for me, Peter.”

Peter – bright-eyed, naive, innocent, Peter – perked up and shot the sorcerer a wide grin. “Anything, Mister Strange!”

“If we – you, Tony, and I – are ever in a situation where someone ever needs to stay behind, then you grab Tony and go. Leave me and run.” 

Peter looked conflicted, and he shifted nervously from foot to foot. “Mister Strange, I can’t do that. Mister Stark would probably rip my arms off trying to get back. You-”

“Have lived long enough,” Stephen interrupted gently. “More than enough, really. Fourteen million and then some lives, Peter. I’ve had my share of living. You and Tony deserve yours. You take him and move as far away as you can, Peter. Tony loves you. He won’t rip your arms off, I promise.”

Peter swallowed thickly and nodded hesitantly. With any luck, he’d never have to fulfill Mister Strange’s request.

—

“Peter! Peter, you let me go right now!” Tony screamed, thrashing against Peter’s steel grip. “I have to go back! We need to be in there!”

“I’m so sorry, Mister Stark,” Peter cried, renewing the webbing holding Tony’s feet in place. Before them, the abandoned warehouse rattled and groaned as the swirling vortex within grew larger, consuming more of the building as it expanded. “I’m so, so sorry, Mister Stark. He made me promise. May made me promise. I can’t go back. I can’t let you go.”

“Please, no!” Tony cried, kicking helplessly at the thick webbing. “Stephen is still in there; we can’t leave him! Let me go back! I have to save Stephen!”

—

Tony Stark loved Stephen Strange more than anything.

Tony loved Stephen more than anything, and for that reason, he gritted his teeth and fired a low-powered blast at Peter. It’s not enough to hurt him, but has the force needed to throw the super-human off-kilter and disorient him long enough for Tony to sprint back towards the swirling black portal just as it folded in on itself and blew the building down to its foundation.

—

Peter Parker loved his family more than anything.              

Peter loved his parents. He loved Uncle Ben. He loved Mister Stark and Mister Strange. Peter had loved them all and couldn’t help but wonder why it was always the people he loved that were ripped away from him.

—

Tony Stark loved Stephen Strange more than anything.

Tony loved Stephen more than anything, and for that reason, he gritted his teeth and fired a low-powered blast at Peter. It’s not enough to hurt him, but has the force needed to throw the super-human off-kilter and disorient him long enough for Tony to sprint back towards the swirling black portal just as it folded in on itself and blew the building down to its foundation.

—

Peter Parker loved his family more than anything.              

Peter loved his parents. He loved Uncle Ben. He loved Mister Stark and Mister Strange. Peter had loved them all and couldn’t help but wonder why it was always the people he loved that were ripped away from him.
trail.content_abstract:
May Parker loved Peter Parker more than anything.

May loved Peter, and for that reason, she cornered him in the bathroom one morning after catching sight of his latest battle scars. “Peter Benjamin Parker, you listen here and listen well. Whenever you go on these missions with Tony and Stephen, you let them take the lead. If something…bad ever happens-”

title: Ch 2- Secret Invasion

trail.content:
Stephen takes a ‘which avenger are you?’ test and gets Tony Stark. At the same time some visitors come to bother humanity.

Read Becoming here.

body:
Tony Stark and Death

You know what I just realized? Tony Stark has been associated with the concept, the idea of death in every movie he’s in. In Iron Man, he’s believed to be dead for 3 months and he surprises everyone when he comes back alive. Iron Man 2, he’s dying by palladium poisoning. The Avengers he dies when he goes into space and falls back down. they rip the helmet off, no response. Iron Man 3 his house in bombed, Rhodey and Pepper and the rest of New York think he’s dead. Age of Ultron, climax happens, now Tony gets to see what it feels to see someone you care about die. In the vision, he sees his friend die and he. Just. Can’t. Handle. That. He’s so used to be the one at deaths door that when it’s someone else, he loses his mind. Civil War, Steve slams down the shield breaking the arc reactor, the light going off. The symbol of Tony’s heart, his life was turned off. Basically a symbolic death. Infinity War he gets stabbed and we’re all sure that he’s done for, until he heals himself. There’s two things to note here: the first, Tony Stark is his own hero because in every moment he doesn’t have someone to dive in and save him, he’s had help, but if he wants to keep living, he needs to find a way. The second relates to Endgame, either he will die and all those times were just subtle hints to the end, or rather it’ll show the painful path that Tony Stark has been in and he will finally get to rest and just LIVE.

title: New allies
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2U4yIN2

by Polotime

Bucky ran towards them at high speed not aware of what he was thinking, he shoves one of them and heads for the road, he runs down the road when a huge truck heads toward his way, Bucky turn at the sound and every voice around him disappears, he stops for no reason, he tried to move but his head is not responding but only listening to the sound of the horn, then everything turns black

—————————-
Bucky learned to make new friends and family and meets old “enemies”

summary: For All the World to See
title: For All the World to See
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2Cx9DQY

by AmethystClearwater

The war is finally over. Thanos is gone. most of those lost are back, but not everyone made it back. Those who have been recovered are having a hard time coping with what they went through… and what they brought back.

(Or: Peter and Stephen are back, but they’re not the same as before. Brag some tissues and ice cream, cause this is one hell of an emotional roller coaster.)

Words: 660, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Spider-Man - All Media Types, Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017), The Avengers (Marvel) - All Media Types
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence, Major Character Death
  • Categories: Multi
  • Characters: Peter Parker, Bruce Banner, Stephen Strange, Loki, Steve Rogers, Natasha Romanov (Marvel), Tony Stark, Thor, Clint Barton
  • Relationships: Pepper Potts/Tony Stark, Peter Parker & Tony Stark, Peter Parker & Wade Wilson, Loki & Peter Parker, Peter Parker & Natasha Romanov, Bruce Banner/Peter Parker, Peter Parker & Steve Rogers, Peter Parker & Stephen Strange
  • Additional Tags: Dead May Parker (Spider-Man), Sad Peter Parker, Precious Peter Parker, Protective Loki (Marvel), Peter Parker has PTSD, Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder - PTSD, Anxiety, Peter Parker Has Issues, Peter has magic, cause Strange taught him, Angst, like so much of it, You Have Been Warned
